title: PayPal Shares First PYUSD Report as Stablecoin Market Fades to $131 Billion
description: PYUSD’s $44 million market capitalization suggests the stablecoin’s initial adoption has been slow so far.

title: OpenSea, Rarible, and more NFT marketplaces restrict Stoner Cats following SEC action
description:
At least three non-fungible trading (NFT) marketplaces have restricted trading on the cartoon NFT collection Stoner Cats as of Sept. 18. The project is the brainchild of actress Mila Kunis, who also voices a character in an animated web series that accompanies the NFT collection. Each marketplace has taken a somewhat different approach to restricting […]

The post OpenSea, Rarible, and more NFT marketplaces restrict Stoner Cats following SEC action appeared first on CryptoSlate.

title: South Korean Authorities Take Aim at Unregulated Crypto OTC Desks Amid Money Laundering Concerns
description: South Korean prosecutors and regulators are directing their attention toward reported issues concerning unregulated cryptocurrency-based over-the-counter (OTC) trading and deposit enterprises. During the third annual prosecutors’ conference, officials proposed the necessity for enhanced regulation in the crypto sphere, citing concerns that these enterprises facilitate money laundering and fraud. The Korea Customs Service estimates that unlawful […]

title: The New York DFS updates its regulation guidelines
description: The New York Department of Financial Services announced the new rules on listing various cryptocurrencies on its green list. In the much-anticipated announcement, the NYDFS announced it would be delisting three tokens: DOGE, LTC, and XRP.  Tokens still on the list include Ether and Bitcoin. Through its X platform (Formely Twitter), the department announced that ... Read more

title: South Korean Regulator Takes Aim At OTC Crypto Trading
description:
South Korea’s customs agency recently highlighted crypto trading’s role in illegal forex transactions. The Financial Services Commission (FSC) has also taken note of OTC crypto trading’s role in financial crimes. Unlawful forex transactions via crypto assets reached a whopping $4 billion last year. Korea Customs Service, the customs regulator of South Korea, recently highlighted the […]

The post South Korean Regulator Takes Aim At OTC Crypto Trading appeared first on Coin Edition.
